protocol-stack.name: Base bones
protocol-stack.description: Bare bones stack with only UDP and UNICAST. Multicast is unreliable (members may get a multicast, or not) and messages don't get fragmented (if a message is too big, it will be dropped). However, unicast messages (e.g. responses to multicast messages) are reliable: they will be retransmitted if dropped. Since no membership protocol is included, members have no way of finding other members. Such a functionality has to be done on the application level in this case.

protocol.description: Sends and receives messages on UDP sockets
